HOW LONG DO YOU THINK YOU ALL WILL
LADY BIRD YOU BETTER BE DRESSED
BE I DRANK SO MUCH SODA
I CAN SEE THE LIGHT ON IN YOUR ROOM
LARRY, WHAT ARE YOU DOING ON THE
THEY BAG AT THE GROCERY STORE.
FINE MAKE YOUR OWN FUCKING EGGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those anonymous trucker motels along-side I-5 thro central California. It’s late summer, 2002. Two women sle together in a bed. Christine, aka Lady Bird, 17 years old Her Mom, Marion, the age of Lady Bird’s Mom. A modern-day romantic Mary Cassatt rip-off painting of motherhood.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you think I look like I’m from Sacramento?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Now they’re awake. Lady Bird stares at her re. Marion mak the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You are from Sacramento.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (re: making the bed) You don’t have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well it’s nice to make things neat and clean. Marion is making hospital corners. Lady Bird sits on the just made bed. Marion sits beside her, moves the hair out Lady Bird’s eyes. MARION (CONT’D) Ready to go home?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Ready. INT. 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. CALIFORNIA. DAY. The last sentences of The Grapes of Wrath.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIOBOOK
dialogues.text: “Her hand moved behind his head and supported it. Her fingers moved gently in his hair. She looked up and across the barn, and her lips came together and smiled mysteriously.” You have been listening to ‘The Grapes of Wrath’ by John Steinbeck. If you... (pause) Lady Bird ejects the tape, returns it to the case fromth public library. They are both crying.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (looking on the back) Our college trip took 21 hours and 5 minutes. They laugh and then wipe their tears. It’s a nice moment they both had the same emotion. Lady Bird immediately sta looking for a good song on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (turning it off) Hey, you know, let’s just sit with what we heard?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (bristling) Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: We don’t need to be constantly entertaining ourselves, do we? Lady Bird stares out the window, now sullen. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I wish I could live through something.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Nope. The only exciting thing about 2002 is that it’s a palindrome.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Ok fine, yours is the worst life of all, you win.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD MARION
dialogues.text: Oh so now you’re mad? Because It’s just that you’re being I wanted to listen to music? ridiculous, you have a great life.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I’m not perfect.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Nobody is asking you to be perfect! Just considerate would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really picking a fight) I don’t even want to go to school in this state anyway, I hate California. I want to go to the East Coast.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Your Dad and I will barely be able to afford in-state tuition.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: There are loans, scholarships!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Your brother, your very smart brother, can’t even find a job --

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: He and Shelly work. They have jobs.

dialogues.speaker: THEY BAG AT THE GROCERY STORE.
dialogues.text: That is not a career and they went to BERKELEY .MARION Your father’s company is laying people off right and left you know that? No of course not because you don’t care ab anyone but yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Immaculate Heart is already a luxury.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Immaculate FART. You wanted that, not me!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Miguel saw someone knifed in front of him at Sac High, is that what you want? You’re telling me that you want to see someone knifed right in front of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He barely saw that. I want to go where culture is, like New York.

dialogues.speaker: MARION LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: How in the world did I raise Or at least Connecticut or such a SNOB? New Hampshire. Where writers live in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You couldn’t get into those schools anyway.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You can’t even pass your driver’s test.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Because you wouldn’t let me practice enough!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: The way you work, the way you don’t work, you’re not even worth state tuition, Christine.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD MARION, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: MY NAME IS LADY BIRD! Well actually, it’s not, and it’s ridiculous. Your name is Christine.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You should just go to City College, with your work ethic. City College and then to jail then back to City College. Maybe you’d learn how to pull yourself up and not expect everyone to do everything for you... They slow for a stop light and Lady Bird dramatically ope the door and rolls out of the car. Marion screams.  INT. IMMACULATE HEART OF MARY. DAY. Close on a cast. In very small letters is written “fuck y mom.” The cast belongs to Lady Bird. She follows along wi the mass. CREDITS run over this joint liturgy between Immaculate He of Mary (girls school) and Xavier (boys school) and begin of the year activities. A sea of catholic girls’ school uniforms in bleachers dur candidate speeches.

dialogues.speaker: CANDIDATE
dialogues.text: (finishing her speech) A Vote for Amanda is a vote for boys. Boys and healthy vending machines because no one wants a muffin with that many calories. Lady Bird waits her turn to make her speech, and makes ey contact with Julie in the crowd, a sweet, chubby 17 year Her best friend. 5 classrooms, 5 syllabi, 5 “beginning of senior year” speeches from the teachers. A few teachers are nuns.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: There are the classics: St. Augustine, of course, and Aquinas. My favorite, Kierkegaard - wait until you hear his love story - it will make you swoon. Back in the church, Lady Bird looks intently at an image Jesus. The priest gives his homily.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: We’re afraid we won’t get into the college of our choice, we’re afraid we won’t be loved, we won’t be liked, we won’t succeed. Everyone takes communion. Lady Bird approaches and crosse her arms so she just gets a blessing, not real communion, she’s not Catholic. Lady Bird watches the boys get commun It’s somehow sexy, opening their mouths to receive the wa

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Some of the students were disturbed by your posters.  INT. VICE-PRINCIPAL SISTER SARAH-JOAN’S OFFICE. DAY. Sister Sarah-Joan, in a traditional habit, holds up some Lady Bird’s campaign materials.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It’s just a bird head on a lady body or vice versa.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: I think it’s a little upsetting... Reveal of the poster: Lady Bird’s head on a bird body. Another shows her Catholic-uniformed body with a bird hea

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It’s my tradition to run for office. Don’t worry, I won’t win.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: That’s not what I’m worried about.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (worried) This won’t mess with my scholarship, will it?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: No, you’re okay there. (trying to be helpful) You have a performative streak, I think.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I think that too.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: Maybe you’d enjoy theatre arts... They are having auditions for the fall musical.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Do we have that here?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: It’s a collaborative effort with the men at Xavier.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: How am I a senior and not know we have that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you haven’t always been an active part of this community.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: They do a fall musical and a spring play and from what I hear it’s a real blast.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: What I’d really like is to be on Math Olympiad.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: (gently) But math isn’t something that you are terribly strong in?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: That we know of YET. CLOSE ON A LIST. Sign ups for auditions for the fall musical. A hand reach up and takes the pen attached and writes, in all caps: CHRISTINE “LADY BIRD” McPHERSON And then another hand reaches up and writes: JULIANNE “JULIE” PICKETT

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Julie” doesn’t need to be in quotes.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: But it’s not my real name. Reveal Julie and Lady Bird debating this:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It’s not the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I’m not sure you’re right...  EXT. SACRAMENTO STREETS. LATE AFTERNOON. Julie and Lady Bird walk through the “fancy” neighborhood “The Fabulous Forties.” They stop in front of this very specific house - it is the Dream House: It is three stori and blue, with white shutters and a big American Flag. It looks like nothing bad would ever happen in this house.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I love this neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: If I lived here I would definitely have my wedding in the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I’d have friends over all the time to study and eat snacks. I’d be like “MOM WE’RE TAKING THE SNACKS UPSTAIRS TO THE TV ROOM.”

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’d have my own bathroom. INT. GROCERY STORE. EARLY EVENING. Julie and Lady Bird browse magazines in an empty checkout aisle. A Checker calls out to them:

dialogues.speaker: CHECKER
dialogues.text: I can’t stop you dicks from hanging out here but quit wrinkling all the magazines!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: When I’m in this store, I’m not your sister - I’m a customer, Miguel! I’m always right! This is Miguel. Lady Bird’s brother. 22, Latino, clearly adopted. Julie watches him and his girlfriend, Shelly Yuh 22, a Bagger:

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Ever since she moved in, your brother and Shelly are becoming the same person.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: No way. Shelly and Miguel have the same asymmetrical hair-cut an “interesting” piercings. Vaguely punk looking. Seem like they’ re wearing black leather jackets even when they are LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Yeah, okay, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (re: magazine) See, why I don’t look like that? The girls look at a model in the magazine. She poses in front of the New York City skyline.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Just once I’d like to have the song “New York Groove” play and feel like it really applies to my life.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You’ve never even been to New York.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: That’s why I’m applying to New York colleges - do you know if Sarah Lawrence is actually IN the city?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Your parents would pay for that?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Scholarships, financial aid. I’1l figure it out. My Mom thinks I can’t get in but she is sorely mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What about terrorism?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Don’t be a Republican.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m probably just going to go to City College.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (almost yelling) PUT THE MAGAZINE BACK.SHIT. INT. PSYCH HOSPITAL. EARLY MORNING. Marion yawns. Luis, a large Filipino man, approaches her:  10.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: You doing okay, mama?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Yes, but that was terrifying wasn’t it? Thank god you were there. I guess I can’t have pencils anymore.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, gotta go back to just felt tip markers. Crayola. Marion suddenly remembers she has something, she hand Lui small bag:

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Oh Luis this is for you! I got it for the baby, I couldn’t resist it. He pulls out a frilly pink dress for a toddler.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: She loves pink!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well, it’s really more for you and Andrea than it is for the baby, and I’m sorry I didn’t have time to wrap it....

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: No, it’s perfect.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow... I mean, later? Luis just laughs. INT. 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. EARLY MORNING. Marion drives back home. It is romantic somehow. She love these streets, loves the turns she knows so well. When sh not resenting the stuck-ness of her own life she has an enormous capacity to love it. Remember this moment with Marion. EXT. LADY BIRD’S NEIGHBORHOOD. EARLY MORNING. Marion drives up. Women are watering their lawns, getting paper, doing yard work, touching their flowers. Solidly middle class. Marion waves to neighbors. They wave back. picks up the mail, bills, papers, etc.  11. INT. BATHROOM. MORNING. Dad (50s, name: Larry) brushes his teeth. Marion perched the edge of the tub with a newspaper and a stack of mail, going through it.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Did you know toothpaste is basically ineffective? It’s like sucking on a mint.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (to Larry, shaking her head) Mike Kerry died. I didn’t know he was sick again.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: How old was he?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Only fifty-six. Knocking at the door.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Can Shelly and I get in there?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: In a minute honey Dad and I are still in here!

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (re: Mike) That’s too young.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: I AM DRESSED.
dialogues.text: MARION (CONT’D) I’11 send them a note. (a little softer) Do you think that Shelly and Miguel have sex on the pullout couch?  12.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Marion laughs at Larry’s subtle joke. He laughs at her laughter. They like each other. INT. KITCHEN. MORNING. Miguel and Shelly eat cereal. Larry reads the paper. Mari makes Lady Bird’s breakfast and her lunch.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Why can’t I just make the eggs?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Because you take too long and make a big mess and then I have to clean it up.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: (small voice) Eggs aren’t good for the environment, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (too loud)

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: You heard her.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (placing the eggs) Here, eat quickly, PLEASE.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (re: paper) Look at all these pictures. Every newspaper looks like USA Today.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Shelly and I are trying to be vegan. Hence the soy milk.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You wear leather jackets.  13.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: They’ re vintage. It doesn’t support the industry.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (poking at the eggs) They aren’t done, there’s white stuff.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: You know how you love Brambles? Pigs are smarter than him even.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I never thought Brambles was a GENIUS okay? LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (very obnoxious) MOM! The eggs are NOT DONE!

dialogues.speaker: FINE MAKE YOUR OWN FUCKING EGGS.
dialogues.text: Marion then throws the frying pan violently in the sink a retreats to the bathroom. The noisy hair-dryer starts up.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I WANTED TO YOU WON’T LET ME! Lady Bird follows Marion out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Your sister doesn’t like me.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: MOM!!! I’M HUNGRY!

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: She does. Shelly gets up, pouting. MIGUEL follows her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is left alone. It’s weirdly peaceful for half a sec 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. DAY. Lady Bird and Larry on the way to school. She feverishly changes the radio station, finds a song she likes:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Did you know that Alanis Morisette wrote this song in only ten minutes? —

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I believe it.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (she smiles) So I’m applying to a couple East Coast schools. I need you to help me with the financial aid application but Mom can’t know.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: We... aren’t they quite expensive?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: First, yes that’s why financial aid. Second, I have to get in first.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Mom won’t be happy about it.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Which is why I don’t want to fight about it before I have to.  15. Lady Bird looks up. They are a couple of blocks from scho LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Just pull over here

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Are you sure, I can drive you to the front --

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: No, just this is fine. I like to walk.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Okay, well, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: So what do you think? About college?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I’1l1 see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (kisses him on the cheek Thanks Dad, love you too. Have a good day at work.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m like Keith Richards “I’m just happy to be anywhere.” She gets out quickly and hurries away. She’s almost at sc when Julie pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey bitch! Ms. Pickett has VERY LARGE fake breasts. Her boyfriend, M hands a sack lunch to Lady Bird and Julie.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Alright girls, hope you like pickles.  16.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Uncle Matt.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Sweet! Ms. Pickett gets in the driver’s seat, they drive away.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: He’s not your uncle.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s something I’m trying out. Bye, mom. (watching Ms. Pickett go) Your Mom really likes you.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just keep getting fatter. Lady Bird starts eating the Matt lunch and chucks her own lunch into a garbage can. The one her Mom spent time maki LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (mouth full) Me too. Matt is awesome.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hope he marries my Mom. That would be nice. He promised me his old car when I turn eighteen. In the student parking lot, a girl gets out of her fancy Range Rover. She’s pretty in a high school way.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: That car should be illegal. Jenna Walton’s not doing any off-roading. She just goes to Pavillions.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I heard Jenna Walton has a tanning bed in her house. The girl, Jenna Walton, is very tan. Identical tan girls descend on her.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: She is so pretty.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Her skin is luminous.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Maybe we should try tanning.  17.

dialogues.speaker: INT. VESTMENT ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Lady Bird and Julie sit with their legs up the wall, eati communion wafers out of a large plastic container.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah, in the tub I just scoot myself under like now, like this, and then the water just... She gestures, showing that the water would flow into her crotch and get her off. They are hysterically laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: We are so gross!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I think I figured it out when I was like three or something.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I use, I take off the shower head, oh god this is so embarrassing! I use that.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I don’t know if mine is the right kind, though. Maybe it’s different when you actually have a penis in there, like it’s more intense.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Mine is pretty intense, I think. Darlene, an odd looking girl, has silently walked in.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: You’ re not supposed to eat the wafers!

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (trying to be helpful) They aren’t consecrated. Darlene turns on her heel, annoyed. Lady Bird and Julie dissolve into giggles. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. DAY. Lady Bird, wearing an extreme “audition” dress, and Julie her uniform, sit and watch other students perform.  18. Father Leviatch runs auditions - there is something funny depressed about him. An overweight woman, Miss Patty, accompanies on the piano when needed. A boy, Greg, is up. He has a big voice for such a tinyboy

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: “BEING ALIVVEEEEEEEEEE...... 17 Cut to Father Leviatch calling out from his clipboard:

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: Okay, Christine?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Lady Bird.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: Is that your given name?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: Why is it in quotes?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Well I gave it to myself. It’s given. To me, by me.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: OK, take it away, Lady Bird. Cut to Lady Bird singing her song.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: “Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t it isn’t right, don’t it isn’t niiiiiceeee / Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t walk on the grass....” Cut to Julie, wearing her uniform, shy and nervous:

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (singing) “Make me a channel of your peace / where there’s despair in life let me bring hope / where there is darkness only light / and where there’s sadness ever joy....” Julie has a sweet, clear, beautiful voice. It’s a quiet moment and everyone pays attention.  19. More girls and more boys. Now most everyone is done. Danny stands. He’s very handsome. Strapping, even. He giv his sheet music to the Miss Patty. Then he sings:

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (singing) “There are giants in the sky! / There are big tall terrible giants in the sky! When you’re way up high and you look below at the world you’ve left and the things you know little than a glance is enough to show you just how small you are!” He’s AMAZING. Julie and Lady Bird look at each other. DRE BOAT CITY. INT. LADY BIRD’S ROOM. NIGHT. Underneath her window sill by her bed, Lady Bird writes t name: DANNY. She’s in love and want to make it permanent somewhere. Suddenly, a voice is directed right at Lady Bird’s door:

dialogues.speaker: GO TO BED
dialogues.text: Lady Bird shuts off her light and sleeps, dreaming of Dan

dialogues.speaker: EXT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. DAY
dialogues.text: Lady Bird and Julie check the casting list. They first fi

dialogues.speaker: MERRILY WE ROLL ALONG
dialogues.text: Franklin Shepard: Danny O’Neill, Charlie Kringus: Greg An Gussie: Diana Greenway, Beth: Julie Steffans. They move way down the list until they find: Swing/Chorus: Christine McPherson

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (tightly) Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You too! We both got in!  20.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Everyone who auditioned got in. The part I got was basically not getting in.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (trying to downplay) I do not even know how I got cast in my part.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Me neither. I was the one who had a dress and prepared a song.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (thinking) Now you're going to get romantic with Danny on stage.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s probably my only shot at that, you know?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: She take the pen and crosses out Christine and writes LAD BIRD. Leaves. Julie stays and when she’s sure she’s alone she touches h name - loving herself and the feeling of being chosen. INT. GROCERY STORE. EARLY EVENING. Marion grocery shops. Lady Bird looks at a BRIDE magazine

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (re: the magazine) We don’t need to buy that.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It’s only three dollars. I’m having a hard week.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: If you want to read it we can goto the public library.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I want to read it in bed.  21.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: That’s something rich people do. We are not rich people. Lady Bird walks away and then tucks the magazine undernea her sweater into the top of her skirt, sneakily stealing As she’s performing this maneuver, she sees DANNY (!) and Mom and three little brothers walk by. She walks up brave

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Come here often?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (not getting the joke) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (extending her hand) I’m Lady Bird, we’re going to be in the musical together.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, I remember you! You were wearing that dress.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say what’s up and I’ll see you in rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Thanks, I’m super excited. You live in the neighborhood?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (doing a voice) Nah, I’m from the wrong side of the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Is that your family? There are so many of you!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Irish-Catholic! It’s hard to finda girl to date that’s not my cousin.  22.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (flustered) Well, okay. You’re going to make a great Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Thanks! I want my hair, his hair to be curly, though.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Like Jim Morrison. Very ‘70s.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Like Jim Morrison exactly. DANNY’ S MOM

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Gotta go! Lady Bird walks back to Marion, who is with Miguel while scans their groceries and Shelly bags them.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Who is Jim Morrison again?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: He was in a rock band, moron, The Doors.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I knew that.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (looking at the bill This is with your employee discount?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s already included. Marion looks worried. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. AFTERNOON. Everyone tries to keep up with the dance steps Miss Patty teaches them. She is also, apparently, the choreographer. can move amazingly well for a bigger woman.  23. They play theatre games and do acting exercises. Father Leviatch is actually quite good at casting a spell and ma everyone feel included.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The priest, Father Leviatch, looks around the stage where everyone sits, cross legged, tired from dancing.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: To get our emotions going, we’re going to play “first one to cry wins.”

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: Starting ... Now. I’m playing too. So is Miss Patty. Miss Patty nods. They all try to cry really hard. Suddenly everyone looks - Father Leviatch is sobbing. Everyone is uncomfortable watching an adult man cry.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.. I’m sorry. EXT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. AFTERNOON. Diana, another girl in the play, dishes the gossip while and Lady Bird and Danny wait for their rides:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I heard that before he became a priest he was married and he had a son named Etienne who died of a drug overdose at 17 which was maybe a suicide but my mom says same difference if you are so careless with your life. (a horn honks) Oh that’s her! Gotta go, bye guys! Lady Bird and Danny wave goodbye and then fall into a semi- awkward silence. She sees it’s her Moment. She trie to casually hand Danny a bag but it’s a kind of big bag.  24.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, I almost forgot. I brought you these hot rollers. For your Jim Morrison hair. He pulls out the Conair pink and purple “Hot Sticks.”

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You’ re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You’11 have to show me how to use them.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (weirdly formal) It would be my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: They look like sperms. He laughs and Lady Bird joins in. They do look like sperm but it wasn’t so funny to say it. DANNY (CONT’D) Hey! I just remembered I had a dream about you!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Really?! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We were flying to Disneyland on a giant carrot....

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Awesome!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I love Disneyland.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Me too, I think it’s kind of scary but I also love it. Triumph! They are having a Real Conversation.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ALGEBRA II CLASS. DAY
dialogues.text: Mr. Bruno explains a problem on a projector. He’s handsom and young-ish. Definitely handsome for an all girls schoo Lady Bird zones out, thinking about Danny. Julie looks intently at Mr. Bruno. She loves him, privately.  25.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNO
dialogues.text: (finishing an explanation) Don’t leave me hanging. Can I get a nod? That’s good. Maybe even a verbal confirmation?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (too loud) YES. Julie experience her mini moment of private embarrassment They are handed back quizzes. Julie gets a A-.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNO
dialogues.text: Good job, Jules, I could tell from your work that you even understood the one you missed! He kind of winks at her. She blushes.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (looking at her grade) SUCK A DICK.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to Lady Bird) I like “Jules.” Lady Bird looks at her C+.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I just don’t get why I’m not good at math, my Dad is really good at math. Even Miguel has a math degree.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s your Mom’s fault. INT. HOMECOMING DANCE. SCHOOL GYM. NIGHT. There are a bunch of kids clumped, some dancing, some sit on half-hearted hay bales. The popular girls, Jenna etc., wear tank tops that say (front) Ditch the horse... (and b Ride the cowboy! Lady Bird and Julie now have on bandanas and denim - they doing the Groucho Marx Duck Soup dance to “Tha Crossroads Suddenly Lady Bird stops.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You lose! POINT JULIE!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: No, look  26. Across the dance, there is Danny. He’s wearing chaps, a h a hat, fake pistols. Like teenage John Wayne. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Wish me luck.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Luck. Julie watches as Lady Bird makes a bee-line for Danny.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Wanna dance?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah! They start slow dancing together. Julie does the duck-sou dance alone and then stops. It’s pointless without a budd She falls back and watches. Sister Sarah-Joan walks by Lady Bird and Danny:

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: Six inches for the Holy Spirit! They roll their eyes: Rules! Once she leaves Danny pulls Bird close again. She swoons. Life is happening. EXT. SCHOOL GYM. NIGHT. Lady Bird, Julie and Danny wait outside of the dance, lea against the gym waiting for their parents. Julie’s Mom pu up with Uncle Matt. Honks.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to Lady Bird) That’s us!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Nah, my Mom is coming.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: No she’s not.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (pointed) Yes, she is.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: But the plan was sleepover at -

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: IT’S FINE.  27. Lady Bird is clearly trying to stay there with Danny.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Okay, bye then. Julie gets in the front seat to practice driving. Leaves. Lady Bird and Danny are quiet, listening to the muffled sounds of the dance. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Have you ever been out of the country?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: When I was little, my Dad had a job that took him to Brazil. I remember from the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I’ve never been out of the country. It’s my dream to go to Paris.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (sighs) Paris.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: That’s why I’m learning French.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: My mom said French wasn’t useful.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It is if you want to go to Paris. They laugh. DANNY (CONT’D) I still don’t know how to use those rollers you gave me.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s so easy, like after they heat up, you just take your hair and twist the hair and then twirl the thing like this... She reaches up to his hair. He kisses her. It’s surprisin They kiss again. It’s romantic, really romantic. EXT. SACRAMENTO STREETS. NIGHT. Lady Bird walks home. She’s smiling so huge and throws he face to the sky and screams. INT. HOUSE. NIGHT.  Marion and Larry are arguing with a lot of financial documents strewn across the kitchen table. 28.  29.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Larry how long will this hold us.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know... Lady Bird opens the back door, glowing and shiny from the night and the kiss. She sneaks past.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well, someone must know. Can the whole family go on Cobra, even Miguel? What happens if someone gets in an accident?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure - the severance package I think it expires all at once, not within the calendar year... Lady Bird tip-toes into her room. She knows she wasn’t supposed to see this. And she doesn’t want to know any mo

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’ll ask at my work if -- Suddenly, a noise makes her turn her head sharply. MARION (CONT’D) Is she home?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Maybe leave it for tonight...

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, she knows better. (getting up) She cannot sneak around like this... Marion barrels down the hallway towards Lady Bird’s room. INT. BEDROOM. NIGHT. Lady-Bird, under the covers, hears her Mom coming. Then a the lights come on, it’s so bright:

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Christine! You can’t leave your room like this!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I didn’t...  30.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: None of these things were put away right, they aren’t nice,

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (weakly) My name is Lady Bird.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Don’t lie to me, Christine! Lady Bird sees her Dad pass by the door and give her a lo like “I’m sorry, I can’t help you here.” He disappears. Marion picks up her uniform.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: NO, this uniform is going to look like TRASH on Monday! MARION (CONT’D) This isn’t right - we can’t treat our clothes like this. I don’t know what your wealthy friends do...

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Why do you care what I do tomy clothes? Marion closes the door..

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Your father does not have a job.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: He lost his job, okay? Do you need him to come in here and explain that to you?  Lady Bird Lady Bird 30.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Of course he wouldn’t do it anyway, he’s Mr. Nice Guy. I always have to be the Bad Guy.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Can we please talk about this tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You can’t look like a rag because that makes us look like rags. And you want to know the truth? Here’s the truth: some of your friends’ fathers could employ your father and they won’t do that if it looks like his family is trash. puts all her clothes away while Marion watches.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (quietly) Didn’t you ever go to sleep without putting all your clothes away perfectly? Like even once? And don’t you wish your Mom hadn’t gotten angry?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: My mother was an abusive alcoholic. has nothing to say to this, Marion wins. INT. GUIDANCE COUNSELOR’S OFFICE. DAY. Lady Bird looks at some brochures. The Guidance Counselor looks at her grades and test scores.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: So I understand that you’re not interested in any Catholic colleges?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: No way. Sorry, but yes, no way.  31.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: Then you’1l be applying to UCs and State schools?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yes, but also those East Coast liberal arts schools. Like Yale, but not Yale because I probably couldn’t get in.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: (laughs) You definitely couldn’t get in. Part of my job is to help yoube realistic.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: That seems like everyone’s job.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: Your SAT scores are strangely very good. Lady Bird shrugs. GUIDANCE COUNSELOR (CONT’D) I’d placed some calls to local alumni of the schools you’re interested in, but unfortunately all the interviews are taken.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: So... what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: It means that you’ll have to get in on how you look on paper. INT. THEATRE. DAY. The kids rehearse -- following dance moves and singing. EXT. ROSE GARDEN. NIGHT. Lady Bird and Danny lie on a blanket in the park, looking at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t we go home?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) My Mom is always mad. It doesn’t matter if I get home late, she’d be mad at me anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Mom is hard on you.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (defensively) She loves me a lot. (then) Pick a star for us.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (pointing) That one, right there right next to the bright one and then the dim one - see it?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: That’s our star. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (whispering) You know you can touch my boobs, right?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I know... it’s just.... I respect you too much for that.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, cool, awesome. I totally get that. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You're welcome.  33.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: If you had boobs I wouldn’t touch them either.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I respect you so much because... I love you.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I love you, too. They kiss and look back up at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Let’s name our star Claude. Lady Bird makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: That’s pretentious, don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It’s French. (then) What should we name it?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE.
dialogues.text: They laugh and kiss and yell to the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: I LOVE YOU
dialogues.text: They hug and are the happiest they’ve ever been, looking at the sky and loving each other.  34. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (whispers) Bruce. EXT. HALLWAYS OF IMMACULATE HEART OF MARY. DAY. Julie and Lady Bird wander the hallways. Julie shoves a cupcake in her mouth, so does Lady Bird. The wander and c contemplatively.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (not really to anyone) It’s normal to not touch a penis.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (looks around, notices everyone is gone) I have to go to class.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: But I have free period!

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I need to pass history!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I think we’re done with the learning portion of high school.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Bye, love you. Julie takes off. Lady Bird lazily walks the halls. She sees her empty math classroom and sees that Mr. Bruno isn’t there. She ducks inside. Notices his grade binder o the desk. Snatches it and then runs. She dumps it into one of the big trash cans and hurries a  35. INT. THRIFT TOWN. DAY. Marion and Lady Bird are looking through dresses.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Did Danny say whether his grandmother has a formal Thanksgiving?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I don’t know, there are a lot of kids, but she lives in the fab forties...

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (nodding) Your dad and I went to a dinner party once in that neighborhood, the CEO of ISC, and it was pretty formal. Lady Bird finds something - holds up a black dress. They keep MARION (CONT’D) You’re not going to a funeral.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t know! What says “rich people Thanksgiving”? looking.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It’s just such a shame that you’re spending your last Thanksgiving with a family you’ve never met instead of us, but I guess you want it that way. (clocks her walking) Are you tired?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: No. A saleswoman, Joyce, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Hey Marion! Marion waves to the saleswoman. Her voice is so warm and friendly with other people who are not her daughter:

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Hey Joyce! How’s the baby!  36.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: He’s crawling!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Ooohhh, I want to see a picture at checkout! (back to Lady Bird) If you’re tired we can sit down.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I’m not tired!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Oh it’s just that I couldn’t tell because you’re dragging your feet.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (silence)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well, I just couldn’t tell.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just say “Pick up your feet.”

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I didn’t know if you were tired.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You were being passive aggressive!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No. I wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You are so INFURIATING.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Please stop yelling.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I’m not yelling. Marion sees something. Holds it up. It’s a beautiful old fashioned looking dress. Marion has found the needle in t haystack. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Oh it’s perfect!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Don’t you love it.  37. INT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. LATE AT NIGHT. Marion, still in her nurses uniform, sits at the sewing machine, tailoring the dress she and Lady Bird found. She finishes, and then hangs it up quietly in Lady Bird’s roo Doesn’t wake her up, simply watches her daughter sleep fo minute. INT. ALGEBRA II CLASS. DAY. Mr. Bruno addresses his class: MR. Bruno So because my gradebook has disappeared, I am going to count on you to reconstruct it. I know you all know your grades better than anybody. I have a general idea, but this is all about the honor code right now, okay? They are going up one by one to talk through their grade he can start again.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: MR. Bruno I’m pretty sure it was an A.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Um, I’m not but okay... MR. Bruno It was - trust me, I know talent when I see it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You’ re welcome. No, thank you. He does that wink thing at her again. She retreats, red faced. Lady Bird is next:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Hey, I think B. MR. Bruno I thought it was more like B- maybe even C+ territory.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: No, because I did really well on the last quiz...  38. MR. Bruno I seem to remember you doing only slightly better.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It brought my average up to aB. MR. Bruno Okay, B it is. It’s your honor. INT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. DAY. Marion, Larry, Shelly and Miguel run around making sure t house is perfect for their Thanksgiving. The doorbell rin

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Marion opens the door, lets in Danny.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Hello, Danny! The famous Danny! Aren’t you adorable! (she hugs him) Larry isn’t he adorable?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: He’s adorable.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: And you're driving her and everything - Wow!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Thank you for letting Lady Bird come to my Grandmother’s Thanksgiving, Mrs. McPherson.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No more politeness, just call me Marion!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (firmly shaking Larry’s hand) Nice to meet you, Mr. McPherson.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Please, call me Mr. Larry McPherson.  39.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (hits him) Larry! Sit down Danny, can I get you something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Oh no, I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (waving) Hi, I’m Miguel. The brother. I think Lady Bird wants to make an entrance. She’s mad we don’t have a spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Is my name. They’re quiet for a moment. Danny tries to converse:

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It’s funny, on my way here, I went over the train tracks --

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You took H street?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Right, and so just Lady Bird always says that she lives on the wrong side of the tracks, but I always thought that it was, like, a metaphor.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: But there are actual train tracks. Marion’s face contorts. This is painful. Just then, Lady Bird enters, looking beautiful in her vin dress. She holds a duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (now upset with her) What in the hell is in that duffel bag?  40.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it, Jeez!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: My grandmother will love that dress. INT. DANNY’S GRANDMOTHER’S HOUSE. LATE AFTERNOON. Thanksgiving. It is at the Dream House. From the beginnin The blue one with the white trim and the American Flag. L Bird cannot believe it.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Wait, this is your grandma’s house? Oh my god. She meets his Grandmother, almost kisses her hand like sh a queen but pulls back just in time:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Your house is my favorite in all of East Sacramento. Lady Bird and Danny walk through the house. She spots ver prominent Ronald Regan poster: LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Is this... a joke?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No. Lady Bird meets people, so many people, and in a lull, fo a napkin in a cool way - it looks like a four-pointed flo Danny’s Grandmother notices, and IS TOTALLY INTO IT. Soon Lady Bird is folding all the napkins at the tables this w teaches her how to do it, too. It is clear how much Danny Grandmother enjoys Lady Bird. INT. DANNY’S CAR. NIGHT Lady Bird and Danny are singing along with songs from the show. Pick up Julie from her apartment complex. Pick up G from his house. Now they’re all singing. In the car, they change out of their Thanksgiving “finery and put on what they consider to be “people who listen to music in coffee shop” outfits. That was what the duffel w for, the costume change. There are scarves and a beret. EXT. ALLEY BEHIND NEW HELVETIA COFFEE SHOP. NIGHT. In their new outfits, Greg and Danny and Julie and Lady B smoke a out of a bowl, which another one of them lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know when it’s working? 41.  42.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You’11 know.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It’s not working.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s not? My sister said this was premium.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m working.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I’m working too.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Nope. They are quiet for a second. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) I can’t feel my arms.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You’ re working. They laugh really hard. Danny makes out with Lady Bird. INT. NEW HELVETIA COFFEE SHOP. NIGHT. They hazily take stock of everything. There are some iron turkeys pinned up on the stage. The “cool kids” are there. They don’t say hi but they don shun them. Jenna Walton is there with her boyfriend, Jona Ruiz. He’s singing pretty terrible songs about her with h band, the pretentiously named L’enfance Nue.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (whispered to Julie) If Danny and I get married and then his Grandma died, I’d inherit the Dream House.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t his parent’s get it?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (realizing) Oh yeah, we’d have to kill them. And kill his older brothers, too.  43. Kyle Scheible, a long-haired beautiful bassist, is really into it. Lady Bird spends an extra-long time looking at t Kyle Scheible. She feels DEEPLY ATTRACTED to him. She loo at Danny, she loves him, yes, but there is something else going on with Kyle Scheible. She’s not sure, maybe it’s t pot. Maybe not. REMEMBER KYLE, Lady Bird will. Meanwhile, Mr. Bruno is there - weird. He looks at Julie, was looking at him. She turns quickly away.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to no one) Where is Mr. Bruno’s wife...? INT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. NIGHT. Lady Bird and Danny stand by the microwave, making “Smart Ones” frozen dinners. Six of them. Greg and Julie also ea everyone with their own spoon taking bites out of the different platters. Then Marion walks in - they are still giggling, she awkwa announces herself:

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: How’s it going? No one can say anything, it’s almost like they’re frozen. Finally Lady Bird is able to squeak out:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Mom, we really can’t talk right now. They all dissolve into giggles again.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Well, Happy Thanksgiving. We missed you, Lady Bird. Marion leaves. She’s hurt and angry but mostly hurt. EXT. LADY BIRD’S FRONT YARD. NIGHT The kids all pile back into Danny’s car. Lady Bird waves goodbye, all of them laughing. Then they are gone. Lady B shivers a little, now alone. Startles when she sees Shell smoking:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (curious) Why does that cigarette look so weird? Like not like cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly offers her a drag. Lady Bird drags and coughs.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: It’s a clove. Lick your lips. That’s why they’re sweet. (then) Your Mom was really sad you weren’t here tonight for Thanksgiving.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Well, she hates me.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: She has a big heart, your Mom. She took me in after my parents freaked out about, whatever, pre-marital sex. I admire her. Lady Bird doesn’t fight Shelly. INT. XAVIER. GIRLS DRESSING ROOM. EARLY EVENING. Buzzing in the girls dressing room. It’s opening night! They are putting up pictures and do-dads. They are exchan “opening night” gifts. The girls are applying too much makeup. There is music playing and lots of screaming. INT. XAVIER. BOYS DRESSING ROOM. EARLY EVENING. The boys also get ready. They are putting on powder and combing their hair. It’s less loud, but also kinetic.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING.
dialogues.text: All the boys and girls are gathered in a circle. Father Leviatch and Miss Patty are leading the prayer.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: FOREVER
dialogues.text: They break and cheer. It’s time for the show. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. NIGHT. The show is about to begin. The audience sits in the dark The students in the wings. The paltry orchestra strikes u the first chord. MERRILY WE ROLL ALONG is actually a pretty upsetting and adult show. Julie sings a song about divorce. The other “fabulous” girl, Diana, plays a character who has an affa There’s lots of pretend drinking of alcohol. They dance a sing their hearts out Everyone cheers at the end, but more about the fact of th show as opposed to the show itself. The audience includes the whole of Lady Bird’s family, Julie’s Mom and Uncle Matt, Danny’s whole Irish-Catholic clan. Everyone is proud. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. NIGHT. Mingling after the show. Some of the administrators look scandalized. Julie sees Mr. Bruno and approaches him, feeling beautifu and confident:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNO
dialogues.text: There she is! Jules, wow! You were so good. I couldn’t believe that.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNO
dialogues.text: Jules, I’d like you to meet my wife, Becky. Becky this is Jules, one of my brightest students.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (devastated) Nice to meet you, too.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNO
dialogues.text: How we doing?  46.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m a little tired.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRUNO
dialogues.text: Okay, I gotta get her home, we’ve got the little one, but great work Jules.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (as they leave) Congratulations. Julie is humiliated, and doesn’t quite know why. She sits down next to Father Leviatch, who also looks traumatized. watches people pass him by:

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: They didn’t understand it INT. DINER. NIGHT. The entire cast and crew is there, enjoying their opening night, eating a lot of chicken fingers and french fries. are being silly and playing a Broadway trivia game. Lady and Danny make towers with the sugar packets. Julie and G hang out together: they’re both the “extra” friends. Ever is giddy and happy. INT. DINER GIRLS BATHROOM. NIGHT. Julie and Lady Bird wait for the stalls to open up.

dialogues.speaker: STALL WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS MEMBER, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: I just got my period!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! Lady Bird leaves.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  47.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: There’s never a line in the men’s room! INT. MEN’S ROOM. NIGHT. Lady Bird opens the door and opens a stall and there, in front of her: Danny and Greg making out hard. Julie comes tumbling in from behind. INT. JULIE’S ROOM. JULIE’S HOUSE. NIGHT. They both cry. They listen to “Crash Into Me” by Dave Matthews and sob. The song ends and Lady Bird starts it over. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. NIGHT. They perform the next night. No fun. It’s no fun because their boyfriends are gay. INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE. DAY. Lady Bird gets her cast off with a saw. Marion watches. The doctor throws the cast in the trash. She is mournful. INT. ST. FRANCIS. DAY. Finals. Lady Bird casually cheats off the girl sitting ne to her. INT. LIVING ROOM. CHRISTMAS DAY. Everyone gets socks and underwear for Christmas. Even She

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: They’ re really nice socks.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: They’ re expensive, actually. They wick moisture away from your feet.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Yeah my feet always have moisture.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Mom, I love them.  48.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I’m sorry it’s Small Christmas. We wanted to, well, it’s just a little small this year. Larry opens his gift. (laughing) It’s just what I needed, honey. He holds up a throw pillow that says “Golfers Don’t Diet Just Exist On Greens.” He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (laughing, too) It makes me laugh. INT. LADY BIRD’S ROOM. NIGHT. A gentle knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad? Come in.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (entering) How did you know it was me?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Mom doesn’t knock.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (laughs) No, she doesn’t. He gives her an envelope. Quietly says: LARRY (CONT’D) Here they are, your completed financial aid applications. Merry Christmas. Lady Bird throws her arms around Larry.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Do you need money for the applications? Because I can help with that, too, I just need to --

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: -- no, no, I’ve got that, summer jobs covered it. INT. FAMILY/COMPUTER/MIGUEL’S ROOM. COMPUTER. DAY. Lady Bird frantically fills out her applications: address things, puts materials in envelopes.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: This is why we have computer shut- off time - this is our room. He indicates Shelly, looking forlorn by the pullout sofa-

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, just can you drive me to the post office on J? It should still be open. EXT. POST OFFICE. NIGHT. They are just closing up for the night. Lady Bird runs up posts them at the last minute. EXT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. PORCH. MIDNIGHT. Lady Bird and her family are out celebrating New Years. N makers and sparklers. Happy 2003! Everyone wears the glas with the zeros for the eyes. INT. NEW HELVETIA COFFEE SHOP. AFTERNOON. This is where she got high the first time and the band pl - now Lady Bird learns the cash-register, espresso machin and then sees Kyle Scheible, that amazing looking bassist sitting at a table outside, plowing through “The People’s History of the United States.” Later, he steps outside to smoke, she notices and follows

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Hey! I like your band with Jonah Ruiz, L'enfance Nue? (she pronounces it Lenfance New)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (correcting her pronunciation) L’enfance Nue.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I saw your Thanksgiving show. My name’s Lady Bird.  50. They shake hands. There is something instantly sexual bet them. Lady Bird has never felt this thing before. She get all R&B songs ever written in one moment.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s weird you shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah. (lying) Yeah, I’m friends with Jenna and she’s always talking about how great your band is so I wanted to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Jenna’s hella tight. Well maybe I’1l see you at the Deuce or something.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Sure, see you at the Deuce.

dialogues.speaker: COOL TWENTY SOMETHING
dialogues.text: (yelling out to Lady Bird) I’m not paying you to flirt!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I wasn’t flirting.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I wish you had been. And then he’s gone. Lady Bird’s loins are on fire. INT. LADY BIRD’S ROOM. NIGHT. She writes Kyle’s name next to where she’d written Danny’ name. Touches her hand where he’d touched it. Then touche her mouth. She wants, she wants.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joint liturgy at another beginning of the semester. Lady sits next to Julie and sings in the choir and scans for K From under her choir robe, Lady Bird pulls out “The Peopl History of the United States” and reads it while the prie delivers the homily. Danny tries to make eye contact with Lady Bird but she co looks away. Her eyes rest on Jenna - she wants Kyle as he boyfriend and Jenna as her friend. She wants to be part o this thing, this popular-straight-kid thing she’s always outside of. Lady Bird takes her blessing, arms crossed. INT. HOMEROOM. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: The first time we did it was at his lake house last summer. It was so funny... Julie hands Lady Bird a sack lunch:

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: From Uncle Matt. I think he and my Mom are fighting, so enjoy these lunches while you can.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, no thanks, I’m trying to lose weight.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Really? But Lady Bird isn’t paying attention. She’s angling towar Jenna Walton, the tan, who holds court:

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, sex is not a big deal, it’s just my mom called during it! Everyone laughs.  51. JENNA (CONT’D) It was on my cell phone, she got it for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Did you pick up?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was like, "um, Mom, I can't really talk right now." Everyone else laughs again. Julie now tries to join in:

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to Jenna) What was the emergency?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: What? Oh, my great aunt died.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What was the emergency?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Oh, my great aunt died.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: She kind of did it to herself. Yeah. I don’t know why do that if you’re already so old. Sister Sarah-Joan approaches:

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: Ladies - skirts? Jenna's skirt doesn’t make the grade, it’s been hemmed. SISTER SARAH-JOAN (CONT’D) I’m going to write you a citation, Miss Walton.  52.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: No more short skirts! She continues on, inspecting other skirts.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Sarah-Joan is all up in my jock.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: She’s a cunt.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Birdy you like her.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah, but, she’s a cunt. (to Jenna) I have an idea of how to get Sarah- Joan back...

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You’1l see. This afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: No, we have auditions this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I don’t think I want to do the play. (to Jenna) Meet me in the teacher’s parking lot at 3. I’1l have the materials.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Wait what was your name?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Lady Bird.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Weird.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: We have a decision to make: prom themes! The top options are -- Cities of the World, Eternal Flame, and Movies! INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. DAY. Everyone who has come to audition is greeted by the new director: Father Walther, also the JV football coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’s Father Leviatch?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER WALTHER
dialogues.text: Alright let’s have everyone take a knee. Confusion. Miss Patty won’t make eye contact with them

dialogues.speaker: MISS PATTY
dialogues.text: Cozy sit.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER WALTHER
dialogues.text: So I know that you all miss Father Leviatch, all of the brothers do too, but I am going to give this my very best shot, okay? Usually I’m the J.V. football coach, but from what I can tell a “play” is a “play.” No real response. Danny sits with Julie, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Where’s Lady Bird?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (quietly angry) With her new best friend. She thinks she’s too cool for theatre. Father Walther wheels out a blackboard and picks up chalk

dialogues.speaker: FATHER WALTHER
dialogues.text: Now if you can pull out your scripts. I’ve assigned a number to each of your roles. I’m going to put the blocking on this board, and if you guys can transcribe into your plays, that’d be great.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (calling out) Who is playing what part?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER WALTHER
dialogues.text: I had Miss Patty assign parts because she already knows you all. Miss Patty nods. FATHER WALTHER (CONT’D) Call ‘em out Miss Patty! Miss Patty starts:  54.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PATTY
dialogues.text: (slightly drunk on power) Uh, Prospero, Danny. Julie is Miranda - she’s happy, maybe she’s good at this? EXT. TEACHER PARKING LOT. AFTERNOON. Jenna and Lady Bird are decorating the nun mini-van with cans and streamers and attach a sign to the back that rea JUST MARRIED TO JESUS. As they’re completing their mission:

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Wait, where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, um, the 40s.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: That’s where our starter house was! Which street?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (lying, again) Um, 44th it’s, um, it’s the three story blue house with the white shutters and the American flag in the front. She describes the house that she and Julie lusted after l fall, Danny’s Grandmother’s house.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: I know that one! Wanna go over there now and eat? I live in Granite Bay otherwise I’d say lets go there.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Um, actually, I was thinking - maybe we should go to the Deuce? (trying to be casual) I was talking to Kyle about it and he was like “whatever it’s lame but maybe I’1l see you there.”

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: How do you know Kyle?  55.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: My Mom made me get a job at New Helvetia to learn “responsibility” Anyway we hang out there.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, Kyle’s awesome. let’s Deuce it up. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. DAY. Father Walther is writing all the blocking on the blackbo like the football coach he is. All the students are frantically taking down the notes in their scripts. EXT. SIERRA II. “THE DEUCE.” PARKING LOT. DAY. Jenna joins Jonah & co in the parking lot, drinking and smoking. Kyle is there, sitting on top of a car reading another big book, a theoretical math book. For fun.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: This is the Deuce? It’s a parking lot? We were in one parking lot and we went to another parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: (calling out) KYLE! Lady Bird and I just decorated the nun-mobile like “just married to Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That’s hella tight. He nods, appreciating this. Jonah starts to make out with Jenna. Lady Bird tries not to watch. KYLE (CONT’D) What you did was very baller, very anarchist.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuck ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I’m not gonna snitch on you.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (fake threatening) I hope not, because I’d fucking kill your family.  56.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Sorry that was an exaggeration.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. My Dad has cancer. So I guess God is doing that for us.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh... I’m sorry. They’re quiet for a second, he’s said something heavy.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You work at New Helvetia, right?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Can I get your number? We were looking to set up some more gigs down there...

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Definitely. He holds out his hand and a pen. Lady Bird takes his hand the pen. When she touches him, it’s the same as before: S LADY BIRD (CONT’D) It’s my parents’ number.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You don’t have a cell phone?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Good girl. The government didn’t have to put tracking devices on us, we bought them and put them on ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I don’t own a tracking device...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No the cell phones. See?  57.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. I mean you’1l have one eventually. Everyone’s gonna have one. And then it’1l be a matter of time.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Before what?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Before they put them in our brains. Lady Bird laughs and then stops herself. He is dead fucki serious. She wants to touch him again but can’t invent a reason why. INT. NEW HELVETIA COFFEE SHOP. AFTERNOON. Lady Bird works. Zones out from time to time, thinking ab Kyle. Danny comes in and then lurks. She spots him, goes throw out the trash, annoyed that he’s there. EXT. ALLEY BEHIND NEW HELVETIA COFFEE SHOP. AFTERNOON. Lady Bird walks out, Danny follows her. She wheels around

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? He doesn’t say anything. LADY BIRD (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: My Grandma wanted me to tell you she missed you at Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I couldn’t have gone anyway... my Mom was pissed about Thanksgiving.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (nodding) Your mom is crazy. I’m scared of her.  58.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (suddenly defensive) She’s not crazy, she’s just, she has a big heart. She’s very warm.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I don’t find your mother warm.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You don’t?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Well no yeah she’s warm but she’s also kind of scary.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You can’t be scary and warm.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (logically debating) I think you can, your Mom is. LADY BIRD YOU’ RE YOU’ RE GAY! That shuts him up. They’re quiet.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (suddenly, desperate) Fuck me. Can you not tell anyone, please? I’m so sorry about everything. I’m so ashamed of all of it. It’s going to be bad and I just need a little bit of time to figure out how I’m going to tell my mom and dad. He almost starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (pats him awkwardly) Don’t worry, I won’t tell.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (leaning into her,sobbing) Thank you.  He’s telling 59. the truth and she is genuinely touched. They embrace again. They are friends, real friends now. INT. PSYCH HOSPITAL. CHECK-IN. DAY. Marion helps a patient fill out a questionnaire. It is Fa Leviatch, who looks how he feels - crushed by bottomless despair. This is his struggle. She looks

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: ...and do you have a support system?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (gently) Who do you turn to when you feel this way?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: No one, I guess. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No, no, don’t be sorry. There’s no wrong answer. at him with true empathy. He realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER LEVIATCH
dialogues.text: Please don’t tell your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: No of course not. Of course not.  60. INT. CHURCH. DAY. All of Xavier and Immaculate Heart of Mary are assembled Ash Wednesday Mass. Everyone gets ash on their forehead. Julie looks on envio as Lady Bird jokes around with Jenna and flirts with Kyle from across the aisle. The priest repeats the incantation every time he applies ashes to the foreheads.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Remember that you are dust and to dust you shall return... Remember that you are dust and to dust you shall return.... INT. FAMILY/COMPUTER/MIGUEL’S ROOM. DAY. Lady Bird sits at the computer with a list of instruction front of her - Marion, Larry, Shelly and Miguel stand beh her.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It’s a new system - you just enter your social security number and... She is presses ENTER and is lead you to a website that li all the schools in the UC system she applied to with a “y or a “no” beside them. They all say no except for... LADY BIRD (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (relieved) Davis is good. Maybe you should have looked at it.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It’s only half an hour away! Less if you’re driving fast!

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I went to graduate school there.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Lots of smart people go to Davis.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I thought Berkeley had to accept me. You and Miguel went there. I’m a legacy.  61.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Eh, not if we don’t give money.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: And you get bad grades.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh what do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (turning red) What are you implying?
