Maybe the best in a long time Maybe ever.  83. INT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. DAY. Lady Bird is back to watching television. The invasion is full on, it’s the Shock and Awe portion of the Iraq war.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Lady Bird! A bunch of things arrived for you! Lady Bird rushes in, snatches the envelopes from his hand

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (turning hot) Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Since when do you get mail?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I get mail.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Whatever you’re up to, it’s not going to end well. INT. LADY BIRD’S ROOM. DAY. She opens a bunch of letters - they are all rejections. EXCEPT for one letter, the letter that says “Wait-listed. She screams silently to herself. Not yes but it’s not no. INT. OFFICE BUILDING. MORNING. Larry sits across from Business Jock, just 30.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS JOCK
dialogues.text: The programmers now are, like, kids, man!

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I know - but that’s why I think with me you’l1l1 find something different.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS JOCK
dialogues.text: YEAH BUT THEY’RE LIKE BABIES.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I hear you, it’s wild. Which is why (pointing at his resume) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: LARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got my MBA at UC Davis while still working at ISC.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS JOCK
dialogues.text: Oh, wow. That must of been a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: It was.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS JOCK
dialogues.text: I heard ISC is closing now, though.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I heard, yes.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS JOCK
dialogues.text: So the assholes who fired you are now closing up shop.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (not feeling it) Feels good. They sit for a second.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS JOCK
dialogues.text: (looking around) Yeah... What else is supposed to happen?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought we were going to talk about the position. INT. OFFICE BUILDING. WAITING ROOM. DAY. Larry leaves his awkward interview to come get Lady Bird. She’s reading a stack of old magazines.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: How’d it go?  85.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Let’s go buy a big bag of Doritos and eat them in the car to celebrate your waitlist.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (laughing) Don’t tell Mom! About the Doritos or the waitlist! Then Miguel enters the waiting room. Larry and Lady Bird double take. Miguel looks much more conventional. Handsom too. All his piercings are out, his tattoos covered.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Oh... hi, son!

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Wait, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: I guess we’re um, going for the same job then?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: It looks like it. Go get ‘em! Larry and Miguel hug. Miguel goes in to the interview. Larry watches him go, feeling how you’d be feeling at that moment. Lady Bird ac for her Dad. INT. VICE PRINCIPAL SISTER SARAH-JOAN'S OFFICE. DAY. Lady Bird hands in homework from being suspended. Sarah-J looks it over, then:

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: I know it was you who did the “Just Married” thing.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: It wasn’t me.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: I’m not going to punish you.  86.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh... why not?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) It was funny. Sister Gina and I drove all the way home before we noticed people were honking.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: To be fair, I wasn’t just married to Jesus. It’s been forty years...

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Well he’s a lucky guy.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: (she considers Lady Bird) I read your college essay. You clearly love Sacramento.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I do?

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: Well, you write about Sacramento so affectionately, and with such care.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I was just describing it.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: It comes across as love.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Sure, I guess I pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER SARAH-JOAN
dialogues.text: Don’t you think maybe they are the same thing? Love and attention?  87. INT. THRIFT TOWN. DAY. Marion and Lady Bird are looking for a prom dress. Lady B is in the dressing room trying things on.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (sadly) I guess you won’t be going to dances in college. This is our last one. (then) You know, Davis has a terrific theatre. If you’re still interested in theatre. Are you? Lady Bird comes out in a dress, it’s too tight: Lady Bird

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I’m probably no good at acting. (looking at herself) Why don’t I look like the girls in the magazines?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It’s too bad I can’t meet this Kyle before prom.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: He’s not my boyfriend anymore. I mean, maybe he never even was.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’d still like to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: (re: the dress) IT’S TOO TIGHT! FUCK. goes back into the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I suggested you not take that second helping of pasta...

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (innocent) Honey, you seem upset about it, I’m trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Mom! You’re giving me an eating disorder! LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (to herself) I wish I could get an eating disorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Bird comes out again. The dress kind of fits her. It bright pink and frilly. She looks happy: LADY BIRD (CONT’D) I love it. Smiles up at her Mom, looking for approval:

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (considering) Is it too pink? Lady Bird silently goes back into the dressing room. Her just crushed something that she liked and was very “her.” Marion picks up that she’s upset: MARION (CONT’D) What?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why can’t you say I look nice?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I thought you didn’t even care what I think.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: I still want you to think I look good.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I was telling you the truth. Do you want me to lie?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: No, I just wish... I wish that you liked me.  89.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Of course I love you. Lady Bird comes out. Looks at Marion with the pure questi

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: But do you like me?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: (faltering) ...I want you to be the very best version of yourself you can be.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: What if this is the best version? INT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. NIGHT. Lady Bird all dressed up in her pink dress. The one Mario didn’t like. Miguel, Shelly and Larry wait with her. She keeps checking the window.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: You look really pretty.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Really? Shelly nods.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: You look like a bad ass girl ina band. This makes Lady Bird feel pretty amazing. Then a car horn honks. It’s Kyle. He literally honks.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Um, I guess, that’s my date.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: You aren’t going to get in the car with a guy who honks, are you?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I think, yes, I am. Larry shrugs, accepting the situation.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Let me get your picture. Mom’s pissed she had to work a double.  90.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (peering out the window) Even you deserve better than this. Larry snaps a picture of Lady Bird, standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Have a good time!

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, good luck! Larry snaps a picture of Lady Bird, standing alone. INT. KYLE’S CAR. NIGHT. Lady Bird approaches and catches Jenna and Jonah talking the back seat:

dialogues.speaker: JONAH
dialogues.text: I think she’s weird.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: She is weird.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (announcing herself Hey guys. I guess I’11l just, sit shotgun? You look really nice, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You look good. He moves some books, probably math books, and she sits. J doesn’t make eye contact with her. INT. KYLE’S CAR. NIGHT. Driving around with Jonah and Jenna. It’s no fun.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hey, what’s going on, man. Yeah, OK, that sounds great. OK. (hangs up the phone) Do you guys want to ditch prom and just go to Mike’s instead?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hate dances.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. No prom.  “Crash Into Me” comes on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I fucking hate this song. 91.  92. He switches it. Suddenly Lady Bird sits up very straight.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I love it.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I actually want to go to prom.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Um, okay? I mean I don’t really wanna do that.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Can you take me to my friend Julie’s house, please?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Who’s Julie?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: She’s my best friend. EXT. JULIE’S APARTMENT COMPLEX. NIGHT. Kyle drops off Lady Bird. Screeches away. Lady Bird stands in front of Julie’s apartment complex. S milling around when a car pulls up: it’s Julie’s Mom, Ms. Pickett - coming in from grocery shopping. INT. JULIE’S ROOM. NIGHT. Julie’s Mom knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: MS. PICKETT
dialogues.text: Julie, honey, there’s someone here to see you. She steps in. Julie looks up, she’s been crying.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Hey, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, I’m fine, I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Really, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Why are you crying? 93.  94.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m just crying - some people aren’t built happy, you know?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. JULIE’S KITCHEN. NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: They laugh really hard. They catch their breath and notic that they are on the last slice of the block of cheese.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: We ate all the cheese! JULIE (CONT’D) It’s ok, Blocks of cheese vary in size, that was a small one.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: So small. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Fuck it, let’s go to prom. Doesn’t your Mom have a dress?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Let’s be honest, I’ve had a dress for months. It’s purple and you’re really gonna like it.  95. INT. PROM. NIGHT. Julie and Lady Bird are slow dancing together. All the decorations, the whole thing, looks like hell, actual hel There are flames everywhere. They are taking pictures together and happy - it is their last hurrah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In their prom dresses. They watch the sun come up over Capital Bridge on the Sacramento River. Their small-town version of the sunrise scene over the Brooklyn Bridge in “Manhattan.”

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: People make so much noise in the movies, but it’s really not a big thing, you can totally be quiet during it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Was it amazing, though?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (thinks) I wanted it so badly but then I found that when it happened, I really like dry humping much more.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You’ re NOT a virgin.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (excited) I can’t wait for State Fair.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: LOG RIDE
dialogues.text: They laugh. Then:

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to be here this summer. All summer, basically.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Well, my Dad, my real Dad, resurfaced in Yellowstone and he wants me to come out there for the summer before I start SCC.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere to college, so it seemed like a good

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (trying to be happy for her) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m going to miss the fuck out of you.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I probably won’t get in. So I’1l go to Davis and I’1l see you every day.  INT. XAVIER THEATRE. NIGHT. 97. Lady Bird sits in the audience and watches The Tempest. C on Danny performing Prospero’s last speech. It’s beautifu

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: now I want Spirits to enforce, art to enchant, And my ending is despair, Unless I be relieved by prayer, which pierces so that it assaults mercy itself and frees all faults. As you from crimes would pardoned be, let your indulgence set me free. The play is over - Father Walther, ever the football coac jumps up and cheers. Lady Bird has tears in her eyes. loves watching her friend’s be great. INT. CATHEDRAL. DAY. Everyone is graduating. INT. RESTAURANT. NIGHT. She Cut toLady Bird celebrating with her family, hugging them

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: To Miguel and his new job!  98.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: To Lady Bird going to Davis!

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (to Lady Bird) Hey, I talked to my manager, and you can totally take over my job for the summer.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Thanks, Miguel!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’m so proud of you, Lady Bird. You walked weird across the stage, but you did it.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I didn’t walk weird!

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: It seemed a little weird, the way you walked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion smiles at Lady Bird. Lady Bird smiles back. Danny walks over to their table.He embraces her in a big hug. They’re friends, real friends.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hi, everyone! I miss you guys! They all chorus that they miss him, too. Proudly: DANNY (CONT’D) Did you find out about the wait list? Marion looks at Lady Bird and then back to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: What? Marion’s eyes darken. INT./EXT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. DAY. Lady Bird is still in her graduation gown. Marion is doin dishes, laundry, not looking at her, not speaking to her. Lady Bird trails after her:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I’m not even in yet, so this might not even be a problem... Mom? Follows Marion into the kitchen. She sees her Dad sitting in the living room, looking scolded: he’s just gotten an earful. Lady Bird keeps pursuing her Mom.  LADY BIRD (CONT’D) I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have gone behind your back, it’s not like I am definitely going to New York. Nothing from Marion. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Mom. Mom. Aren’t you sort of proud that I’m so close to getting in? Just a little? 100 Follows Marion to the backyard, where she begins weeding. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) I mean, yes, I know it was probably easier because 9/11 and less people applying with terrorism and all that, still though ... I’m sorry, I know I can lie and not be a good person but... Follows Marion to the trash can, almost crying. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Please, Mom, please I’m so sorry, I didn’t mean to hurt you - I appreciate everything you’ve done for me, I’m ungrateful and I’m so sorry, I’m so sorry I wanted more... Nothing from her. Marion goes back into the kitchen, screen door slamming behind her.Shouting now, panicked trying to get her attention. LADY BIRD (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: TALK TO ME
dialogues.text: ME. I know, I know, I know I’m so bad, just please! PLEASE. Nothing from her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Bird is learning the ropes of the grocery store. trying to scan items. Hangs out with Shelly. She’s  INT. Lady gets INT. Lady 101 NEW HELVETIA COFFEE SHOP. DAY. Bird puts on her other apron for the coffee shop, and to work as a barista. She’s gotten better. DMV DRIVING TEST. 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. AFTERNOON. Bird is sitting with the driving tester after the test.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVING TESTER
dialogues.text: You passed.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Seriously?!

dialogues.speaker: DRIVING TESTER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVING TESTER
dialogues.text: Not a thanking situation, you either pass or you don’t pass.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yay.  102 INT. LADY BIRD’S ROOM. MORNING. Dad comes in with a cupcake. Lady Bird is 18.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday to you.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You remembered!

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: You’re my only daughter. Well, Shelly too, kind of. Make a wish. Lady Bird blows out the candle. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Are you and Mom going to get a divorce over this?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: No... we can’t afford to! I’m kidding, no. I love your Mom.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (looking down) Does Mom hate me?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: You both have such... strong personalities. She doesn’t know how to help you and that frustrates her.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I wish she’d talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: She will, I know. Happy 18.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Thanks. Do you want some?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Yes. INT. CONVENIENCE STORE. DAY. Lady Bird walks confidently up to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: One pack of Camel Lights, please. And a scratcher. And a Playgirl.

dialogues.speaker: CONVENIENCE STORE CLERK
dialogues.text: 103 ID. Lady Bird hands over her ID.  CONVENIENCE STORE CLERK (CONT’D) (barely looking at it) That’1l be ten eighty seven.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s my birthday today. I’m eighteen. Which is why all these things. I can buy them.

dialogues.speaker: CONVENIENCE STORE CLERK
dialogues.text: Okay, happy birthday. EXT. CONVENIENCE STORE. DAY. She smokes a cigarette. Legally. It’s gross. EXT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. DAY. Early morning. Lady Bird is sitting outside on the porch, writing. Trying to be like a lady poet. The mailman comes and gives Lady Bird the mail. She opens the paper to the obituaries, just like her Mom sees that Kyle’s Dad has died. Richard Scheible (1953-2003). She goes to the lawn and sits down on the grass and think Flips through the other mail. At the bottom is a fat lett from the college. She opens it. She got in. INT. BANK. DAY. Larry and Lady Bird sit in front of a banker.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: So with her scholarships and then if we re-finance the house... then where are we?  INT. KITCHEN TABLE. NIGHT. Marion struggling to write something. She works on a yell legal pad. Keeps throwing away versions. INT. HOUSE. MORNING. Larry gives Lady Bird a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: You’ re only supposed to use it for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (laughs) It’s my tracking device. INT. LADY BIRD’S BEDROOM. DAY. Lady Bird repaints her room, covering the pink walls - an Danny and Kyle’s names - in fresh white. INT. 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. EARLY MORNING. Lady Bird sits in the backseat while Marion drives and La sits shotgun. Sacramento goes by. INT./EXT. 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. AIRPORT. DAY, 2003. Lady Bird and Larry get out. Larry secretly slips a manil envelope into the front of the suitcase. Lady Bird leans back into the car and talks to Marion:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Thank you for driving.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You’ re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: You aren't coming?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: You can't walk up to the gate anymore, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Yeah, but, I'm going to college. Marion can barely look at her, it’s too hard and she’s t mad and hurts too much.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Dad will walk you to security, parking is too expensive here. Marion drives away abruptly. Lady Bird gets smaller in th frame. Marion is the focus. Marion circles, then circles back. She is crying now, she thought it would be easier t not say goodbye but it isn’t. She parks the car. Runs as as she can to go say goodbye. Runs into the airport looking for Lady Bird and Larry. Se Larry walking towards her.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (hugging her while she cries) It’s ok, she’ll be back, she’1l come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Bird unpacks, putting things in their places. She reaches in the front pocket of her suitcase and pulls out A manila envelope. She opens it, and all these letters fa out - crumpled up starts and half-starts. She looks at al them one at a time. They all begin essentially the same: “I love you so much and I don’t know how to tell you that can’t communicate it to you in a way that...”

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Lady Bird is on the phone with Larry:

dialogues.speaker: LARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She was worried that there would be errors, or mistakes or something... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that you’d judge her writing abilities.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I thought you should have them.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I want you to know how much she loves you but also don’t tell her I salvaged them, okay?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Ok... She touches all these letters her mother couldn’t send. A she can never tell her that she has them.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ANOTHER DORM ROOM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lady Bird sits in a dorm room full of college freshman. S stares at a half drunk paper cup of rum inher hand. She looks up, questioning:

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Hey. Do you believe in God?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE BOY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE BOY
dialogues.text: Because it’s ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) People will call each other by names their parents made up for them but they won’t believe in God.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE BOY
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: LADY BIRD
dialogues.text: (considering) Christine. My name is Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m David. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You shake.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: I shake.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Sacramento.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sorry, where? The music was too loud, he hadn’t heard her. Second try:

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Cool! San Francisco is a great city. She is immediately ashamed, but pleased with her social success. She drinks everything.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Lady Bird is very drunk now. She leans out the window. Da does, too. She yells at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE BOY
dialogues.text: No, my name is David. INT. LADY BIRD’S DORM. NIGHT. Back in her dorm with the David. She is so drunk that she half way between passing out and throwing up. David is flipping through her giant CD case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ you have bad music. It’s all Greatest Hits.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: But they’re the Greatest, what’s wrong with that? David puts down the CD case and starts making out with he She throws up all over him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh, god, oh god! He gets up and runs away, out of the room. INT. DORM ROOM. NIGHT. Christine being loaded onto some kind of strap down chair She is crying.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. INT. HOSPITAL. NIGHT. Christine looks up, half awake. A nurse comes into focus.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: What do you want us to do, she’s drunk. Christine passes out again. INT. HOSPITAL. DAY. Christine opens her eyes. Looks at her bracelet. Sits up. child sits across from her with something definitely wron with his eye. She winces. She stands. It seems like she can just walk out. She does EXT. NYC STREET. DAY. Christine is hung over but basically okay. Stops a man:

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: What day is it?

dialogues.speaker: NYC MAN
dialogues.text: Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She walks past a church. People are filing in. So does sh INT. CHURCH. DAY. Snippets of a sermon, some donation baskets. The choir ge up to sing “Blessed Assurance.” Christine listens and then cries, hard, and then starts laughing and singing along. It turns out that her life is just beginning. She ducks into the entry-way of the church. Gets out her phone, calls her home phone. It rings and rings. She leav message:

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Hi Mom and Dad, it’s me. Christine. It’s the name you gave me. It’s a good one. Dad, this is more for Mom - Hey Mom: did you feel emotional the first time that you drove in Sacramento? I did and I wanted to tell you, but we weren’t really talking when it happened. All those bends I’ve known my whole life, and stores, and the whole thing. But I wanted to tell you. I love you. Thank you, I’m... thank you. Hangs up and listens from the back of the church while th choir continues singing. Credits.
